page.title: 19Thorp Perrow, Snape, Yorks.
page.content: The country mansion of Thorp Perrow, now owned by the Ropner family, lies in parkland near the village of Snape. The estate belonged at one time to Sir Robert Danby, who had a feud with Lord Latimer of Snape Castle. This led to violence by both parties and their servants in the sixteenth century. The Milbanke family bought the Castle and Snape village in 1798. The Arboretum was planned by Sir Leonard Ropner over 55 years ago, when he was given 65 acres of land by his father. The Arboretum, which is open to the public, had over 2 000 different species of trees and shrubs collected during his travels, by the time he died in 1977. Some of the trees are rare and are the largest of their kind in Britain. A memorial to Sir Leonard has been erected in the Arboretum.
